authors: Helen Wills Neuroscience Institute, University of California, Berkeley, United States.
text: Our continuous perception of the world could be the result of discrete sampling, where individual snapshots are seamlessly fused into a coherent stream. It has been argued that endogenous oscillatory brain activity could provide the functional substrate of cortical rhythmic sampling. A new study demonstrates that cortical rhythmic sampling is tightly linked to the oculomotor system, thus, providing a novel perspective on the neural network underlying top-down guided visual perception.
title: The Rhythmic Nature of Visual Perception.
